And as no Catholic can deny that voluntary poverty‚ one of the three counsels of perfection‚ would be 3 great gain to the clergy from 3 spiritual point of view, the wilful throwing away of this great gain is strictly and logically called simony by Wyclif. But here again we must remember that Wyclif‚ speaking of simony, is speak- ing of something which, even in its strictest sense, goes far beyond (though it includes) the regular theological definition.
